Articles.Content:
> 
> Wing Connector Type C + Tweakscale ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Tweaks scale crashes my ships ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

I want a single wing part that I can drag out to be a wing, using a similar mechanism to what they have in place for fairings.

Wings, like fairings, can be "special" and be the only things procedurally generated. I don't \*need\* procedural fuel tanks (though I'd prefer them) but making wings out of patchwork pieces and needing to strut them together to keep them from wobbling about independently of each other is not right, and making more (and smaller) pieces is not the answer.

> 
> Tweaks scale crashes my ships ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

It does have it's issues ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

I often stumble upon situation, when I need small square or triangle wing section. No, I do not use TweakScale, and never will. They should be stock. There is some small wing sections in stock, but sometimes I need something of different proportions.

> 
> Title says it all.

It really doesn't. Are you saying you want a new small square wing part? As distinct from the rectangular ones already in the game? Or the small(er) rectangular one already in the game isn't good enough? Or too good? Or not square enough? Or what?

All squares are rectangles, but not all rectangles are squares. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Also, triangles, even small ones, can be different too. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Obviously, most of the wing rectangles are right angle rectangles, but they also can be 1:1, 1:2, 1:3 ...

> 
> I want a single wing part that I can drag out to be a wing, using a similar mechanism to what they have in place for fairings.
> Wings, like fairings, can be "special" and be the only things procedurally generated. I don't \*need\* procedural fuel tanks (though I'd prefer them) but making wings out of patchwork pieces and needing to strut them together to keep them from wobbling about independently of each other is not right, and making more (and smaller) pieces is not the answer.

I was once apposed to procedural wings but I now realize this is the most logical choice. KSP is getting procedural fairings because the number of parts needed to do "building block" fairings would have been crazy. why not just make procedural wings to and solve the wing size part problem once and for all?
Procedural wings could be use just like fairings, there're few wing "base" parts, that could be stretched by moving mouse and mouse wheel and extended into different sections with LMB.
